meanings.sent1: She carefully descaled the fish before cooking it.
meanings.sent2: The chef descaled the fish to prepare it for grilling.
meanings.sent3: After a failed attempt, she descaled the fish with a determined look on her face.
meanings.sent4: The task of descaling the fish felt like peeling away layers of armor.
meanings.sent5: The silver scales descaled from the fish shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Remove the scale or scales from (a surface)
meanings.sent1: He used a special tool to descale the mineral deposits from the bathroom tiles.
meanings.sent2: The cleaning solution effectively descaled the hard water stains from the sink.
meanings.sent3: The bathroom tiles were so dirty that he had to descale them twice.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to descale the surface was as strong as her will to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The descaled surface revealed a sparkling cleanliness that was satisfying to see.
